Community Empowerment for creative innovation (CECI) was formed to address the increasingly deteriorating relationship among refugees and with host communities characterized with ethnic divisions and violent conflicts, address the dire youth situation characterized with antisocial behaviours and practices and to respond to the need for resilience activities that increases livelihood. The CECIwas founded in late May, 2017 by a group of visionary South Sudan youths who were granted asylum or refugee in Uganda due to the war in their native country, South Sudan.
The organization first started as a peace advocacy youth group and later on registered as aCBO under Koboko District Local Government. Taking note of gender balance, the organization has at least embraced gender balance throughout it#s in and outdoor activities giving a 37% portion to women.

participating-org.narrative:
Community Empowerment for creative innovations (CECI) was formed to address the increasingly deteriorating relationship among refugees and with host communities characterized with ethnic divisions and violent conflicts, address the dire youth situation characterized with antisocial behaviours and practices and to respond to the need for resilience activities that increases livelihood. The CECI was founded in late May, 2017 by a group of visionary South Sudan youths who were granted asylum or refugee in Uganda due to the war in their native country, South Sudan. The organization first started as a peace advocacy youth group and later on registered as aCBO under Koboko District Local Government. Taking note of gender balance, the organization has at least embraced gender balance throughout it#s in and out door activities giving a 37% portion to women. 2. ACHIEVEMENTS What have been the principal results in the past three years that contribute to significant, structural, sustained and positive improvement in the lives of men, women, girls and boys suffering from poverty, injustice, insecurity and exclusion? In the past one and half years of our functional existence, besides establishment of a board which plays an oversight, advisory and planning role, and the development and adopting of the supreme constitution of Community Empowerment for Creative Innovation (CECI), the CECI has developed and adopted into laws a significant number of internal policies that include: Finance, Human Resource, Code of Conduct and Anti-fraud and corruption policy manuals that in line with current practices lays down principles, policies and practices on those matters that affect the business of trust, accountability, transparency, inclusivity including the #how we do it# and the #why we do it# as we seek to remain true to our guiding principles of Teamwork, Honesty, Commitment, professionalism, personal development and inclusivity in serving our beneficiaries. Besidesthe partnerships and collaborations with relevant social actors which improved our capacity, we have in keeping with our peopled-led and participatory approach provided both men and women boys and girls space to freely participate in the identifying of gaps and designing of solutions, through the holding of inclusive Peace intercultural dialogues and training workshops training over 180 (F=37%) Peace Ambassadors who actively engaged in their local communities, schools and on various social media platforms have inspired hundreds of their peers to take on peace and responsible social media use advocacy roles. 3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE Mission: What isthe current purpose of the organisation? To innovatively use recreational activities, education and other innovative approaches to address social problems and transform community-based conflicts into a culture of peace and non-violence; and facilitate youth engagement and empowerment at the grassroots level.
Institutional objectives: What are the principal changes the organisation seeks to achieve over the long term?
1. Build peace and improve social cohesion among refugees and with host communities 2. Build skills to support development and peace 3. Promote girl child education and early childhood development 4. Increase community knowledge and understanding of HIV/AIDs care and prevention 5. Eradicate Gender Based Violence 6. Green the environment 7. Foster creativity and innovation among youth in their respective fields of practice
Field(s) of activity: What are the principal thematic and geographic areas in which the organisation works? Who are the social actors that benefit from the work?
1) Peace building and Reconciliation: CECI works to promote peaceful resolution of disputes and reconciliation, build and increase peaceful coexistence and social cohesion among refugees and with host communities through dialogues, negotiations, debates, group discussions, trainings/workshops, recreational activities, poems, media programs and community and school outreaches. 2) Livelihood: interventions are aimed at building skills to support development and peace, build resilience and increase employability through vocational or entrepreneurial skill trainings,trauma healing and income generating activities. 3) Education: CECI#s interventions are aimed at promoting girl child education andearly childhood development through advocacy, increasing community understanding and knowledge about HIV/AIDs care and prevention, and eradicating Gender Based Violence (GBV) in all its forms by going beyond awareness creation to capacitating victims to act. 4) Environmental management: CECI works with the community, stakeholders and well-wishers to green the environment through tree plantingand community education on conservation of environment.
The principal geographic areas of operation of Community Empowerment for Creative Innovation mainly are Koboko District and the refugee camp settlements of Bidibidi refugee camp settlement.
The primary beneficiaries of Community Empowerment for Creative Innovation activities can be broadly defined as the South Sudanese refugees and host communities who will benefit either directly or indirectly through project activities that will be offered by Community Empowerment for Creative Innovation activities and its partners in the district and refugee camp settlements. The specific target groups can be defined broadly as follows: a) Refugee and host communities Youth, Children, Women and other vulnerable groups of people. b) Local authorities, community organizations and associations/groups.
4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING Analyse the environment in which the organisation works? Who are the other relevant social actors, including government and business, and what roles do they play? #In this context, what is unique about the position of the organisation? The environment Community Empowerment for Creative Innovation (CECI) works in is diverse in cultures and ethnicity and is also characterised with some form of fear, ethnic divisions and violent conflicts, intolerance among others, besides being thickly populated by youth who, most suffered adversely armed conflicts, are traumatized,hopeless and idle.
Apart from government and business, other relevant social actors include church, associations/groups, governmental and non-governmental organizations, and institutions. These play roles that range from maintaining law and order, providing relief and humanitarian assistance, educational support, psychosocial and health care to social advocacy.
As the culture of CECI is to work always with the community and other relevant social actors such as earlier identified is in position to influence great positive change, inconsiderate of the closeness of the CECI to the community and the speaking of a common language used by the very diversecommunities we#re committed to serve as well as the diversity of the CECI team and its good relationship with the community, church, CBO/CSOs, and its better understanding of how the community feels. 5. FUNCTIONAL ORGANISATIONAL CHART include below your organisational chart) How are authority and responsibilities structured? For each operational unit, indicate the job titles, number of peoplein each position, and if they are men or women. Kindly find the attached, in PDF, the organizational structure chart of Community Empowerment for Creative Innovation (CECI). 6. CURRENT BALANCE SHEET/FINANCIAL POSITION Oxfam Novib requires information about what the organisation owns, debts that you must pay and your net financial worth. Therefore, we ask for a balance sheet (available in Microsoft Excel) for your entire organisation as it stands at the end of your two most recent fiscal years.

Name of the organization in full (with acronym) C means Community, A means Action, FO means for and T means Transformation abbreviated as CAFOT.
CAFOT is a voluntary, non-governmental organization founded and initiated by group of 15 youths and elderscomprises of refugees and the host community with wealth of experience in community work in different fields. CAFOT is started in August of 2017 desired to engage the refugees youth in particular and the host community in comprehensive peace building, Hygiene and sanitation promotion and advocating for a quality education as a mean of building resilience and health living among the south Sudanese and host communities.

participating-org.narrative:
1. HISTORY: Community Action for Transformation or CAFOT is started in August of 2017 desired to engage the refugees youth in particular and the host community in comprehensive peace building, Hygiene and sanitation promotion and advocating for a quality education as a mean of building resilience and health living among the south Sudanese and host communities. The organization was started by a group of young people with the vision; to create a safe and peaceful atmosphere for human race including his God-given plan, domestic and wild- life and to deliver socio-economic development. So far the organization has improved since its formation andit also has taken gender mainstreaming as co in achieving its vision through programming, planning, andimplementation. 2. ACHIEVEMENTS: So far there is a resilient building among the refugee and the host community through the public forums that CAFOT already carried on since the beginning of 2018. There is trust building among the young people, youth are already getting into groups to start up small business as a means to fight poverty and building a stronger relationship Through our established school, the children are progressively moving in a right direction to face the future, this is meantto ensure illiteracy in removed completely in our society. 3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE: Mission: To see a reduced rate of the prevailing trauma, conflict and to build a health livingamong the refugees and host communities by provision of education, creation of awareness on hygiene and sanitation through participatory drama (forum theatre) and music. a. Institutional objectives: 1. To Open Adult literacy classes, Nursery and lower primary classes 2. To empower the rural women by providing trainingson basic business entrepreneurship skills, and creation of income generating activities 3. To create a flat form for communities to interact on societal issues that affect their living and adopt on the dynamics of the modern change as relates to positive resilience in community development. 4. To promote Hygiene and sanitation, as wellas unity, equality with gender sensitivity, justice and everlasting peace in the community through advocacy and other measures where necessary 5. To create awareness oncorruption, gender-based violence, promote leadership and good governance 6. To promote social understanding among, youth, women, elderly, children and families as a whole, through creation of forum theatre, debates and dialogue this gives them an opportunity to share their own experiences 7. To build the capacities of organized youth groups, drama groups, women associations, RWCs, religious leaders, Boda Boda associations, Taxi Drivers and brokers association, Market management committee, football clubs, local artists, water management committees, Hygiene promoters, Village girl child education promoters (VGCEP) among others through networking meetings and trainings to increase awareness to the grass root
a). Field(s) of activity: 1. Education: We use Physical education which is an integral part of educational program design to promote the optimum development of an individual physically, socially, emotionally, mentally, and spiritually through total body movement in the performance of properly selected physical activities. It is a process by which changes in the individual are brought about through movement#s experiences and it aims not only at physical development but is also concerned with education of the whole person through physical activities. 2. Hygiene and sanitation: Sanitation refers to public health conditions related to clean drinking water and adequate treatment and disposal of human excreta and sewage. Preventing human contact with feces is part of sanitation, as is hand washing with soap. Sanitation systems aim to protect human health by providing a clean environment that will stop the transmission of disease, especially through the fecal#oral route. For example, diarrhea, a main cause of malnutrition and stuntedgrowth in children, can be reduced through sanitation. There are many other diseases which are easily transmitted in communities that have low levels of sanitation, such as ascariasis (a type of intestinal worm infection or helminthiasis), cholera, hepatitis, polio, schistosomiasis, trachoma, to name just a few 3. Peace building awareness programs: Peacebuilding is an activity that aims to resolve injustice in nonviolent ways and to transform the cultural <(>&<)> structural conditions that generate deadly or destructive conflict. It revolves around developing constructive personal, group, and political relationships across ethnic, religious, class, national, and racial boundaries. This process includes violence prevention; conflict management, resolution, or transformation; and post-conflict reconciliation or trauma healing, i.e., before, during and after war. We are currently in Imvepi refugee settlement, but with a plan to reach Rhino and Bidibidi settlements Who are the social actors that benefit from the work? We target youth, (men, women, girls and boys) 4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING: We work directly with the office of the prime minster who is a principle representative of the government on ground, the church leaders, and local chiefs andalready established associations including the line ministries. These actors are supporters of our programs and they act like technical advisors in the day today running of community activities. 5. FUNCTIONAL ORGANISATIONAL CHART In the current board of director, out of seven members, the three are female. We have the Director who is a male and the program manager, while the position of the finance is a female , While the community mobilisers are a mixture of both male and female altogether. 6.CURRENT BALANCE SHEET/FINANCIAL POSITION We have not yet received much funding as a newly established organization apart from being funded on activities basis. This means we always relay on the contribution of our members and the volunteers.
